algorithm_technique: Greedy approach: count seats, place dividers after every two seats, multiplying the distance between them.
problem_summary_simple: Divide a corridor with seats and plants into sections, each with exactly two seats.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through the corridor, counting seats. Place dividers at valid positions between pairs of seats, multiplying counts.
time_complexity: O(n), where n is the length of the corridor.
key_insights: The problem requires dividing the corridor into segments, each containing exactly two seats.
This implies that the total number of seats must be even.
The number of ways to place dividers depends on the number of available positions between pairs of seats.
